definition: to open fire/to shoot a gun
to put/to place/to release/to free/to let go/to let out/to set off (fireworks)
gun/firearm/rifle/spear/thing with shape or function similar to a gun/CL:支[zhi1],把[ba3],桿|杆[gan3],條|条[tiao2],枝[zhi1]/to substitute for another person in a test/to knock/classifier for rifle shots
surname Qiang

sentences.english: The intruders shot up the town.
sentences.chinese: 入侵者在鎮上到處放槍製造恐怖。

sentences.english: One must sight carefully before firing his gun.
sentences.chinese: 在放槍前一定要仔細地瞄準。

sentences.english: Speaking without thinking is shooting without aiming.
sentences.chinese: 不經思考信口雌黃，就像沒有瞄準放槍。

to charge/to pounce on/to swoop down on
ability/skill
to spike the ball (volleyball etc)/to smash (tennis etc)
sudden thrust (that catches the opponent off guard)
hum/drone/buzz
to withdraw/to hole up
to inject poison

to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
